definition: house/room/CL:間|间[jian1]/branch of an extended family/classifier for family members (or concubines)

sentences.english: Maybe we did lose roomers once or twice.
sentences.chinese: 我们可能流失了一次或者两次房客。

sentences.english: The tenant failed to pay his rent punctually.
sentences.chinese: 这位房客未能准时交租。

sentences.english: Mr Lockwood, your new tenant, sir.
sentences.chinese: 先生，我是洛克乌德，您的新房客。

sentences.english: 6 and the landlord with new tenant at the house.
sentences.chinese: 房东陪着新房客在看屋子。

sentences.english: He seriously debated whether or not he should charge his tenants extra for the water.
sentences.chinese: 他认真地考虑该不该向房客们收取额外的水费。

sentences.english: Housemates must not threaten or use physical violence towards any other Housemate.
sentences.chinese: 房客们不可以威胁或使用肢体暴力对待其他房客。

sentences.english: Housemates must not threaten or use physical violence towards any other Housemate.
sentences.chinese: 房客们不可以威胁或使用肢体暴力对待其他房客。

sentences.english: A landlord and a new tenant are talking about rules of the building.
sentences.chinese: 一个房东和一个新房客正在讨论租赁房屋的条例。

sentences.english: Tenants aren't permitted to hang laundry on the balcony.
sentences.chinese: 房客不许在阳台上晾衣服。

sentences.english: After lodger and landlord meet, fu Qi of the rest chummage.
sentences.chinese: 房客与房东见面之后，将剩余的房租付齐。

sentences.english: Mr Lockwood, your new tenant , sir.
sentences.chinese: 先生，我是洛克乌德，您的新房客。

sentences.english: Mr. Jones, this is Bill, your tenant in 8C.
sentences.chinese: 琼斯先生，我是比尔，你的8号C的房客。

sentences.english: Actually, the new tenants turned out to be nine little goldfish.
sentences.chinese: 原来呀，新“房客”是小金鱼。

sentences.english: We moved out on Wednesday and the new tenants moved in on Thursday.
sentences.chinese: 迁出，新房客星期二就搬进来了。

sentences.english: We moved out on Wednesday and the new tenants moved in Thursday .
sentences.chinese: 我们是星期三迁出去的，新房客星期四就搬了进去。

definition: to check out of a hotel room
rent for a room or house
to rent jointly with other people/co-renting
to check in (at a hotel etc)
